body_html: The numerics on a GPU are different than on a CPU, sometimes compromising numeric stability for performance. Does the problem go away if you reduce the learning rate (the usual fix to NaNs)? If it does, i'd expect it is unlikely a bug.
body_text: The numerics on a GPU are different than on a CPU, sometimes compromising numeric stability for performance. Does the problem go away if you reduce the learning rate (the usual fix to NaNs)?  If it does, i'd expect it is unlikely a bug.
body: The numerics on a GPU are different than on a CPU, sometimes compromising numeric stability for performance. Does the problem go away if you reduce the learning rate (the usual fix to NaNs)?  If it does, i'd expect it is unlikely a bug.
